taxon_name.authority: de Candolle in A. P de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle
(Rydberg) C. L. Hitchcock in C. L. Hitchcock et al.

place_of_publication.publication_title: in C. L. Hitchcock et al., Vasc. Pl. Pacif. N.W.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;subfamily amygdaloideae;tribe spiraeeae;genus spiraea;species douglasii;variety roseata

place_of_publication.publication_title: in N. L. Britton et al., N. Amer. Fl.

bio:treatment.description: Leaf abaxial surfaces glabrous or pubescent. Inflorescence branches glabrescent or glabrous. Pedicels glabrescent or glabrous. Flowers: hypanthia and sepals glabrescent or glabrous.
stream banks woodland margins meadows roadsides

verbatim.text: Flowering Jun–Aug; fruiting Jul–Nov. Stream banks, woodland margins, meadows, roadsides; 300–2500 m; Idaho, Wash.

parsed.habitat: Stream banks, woodland margins, meadows, roadsides;

bio:treatment.discussion: P. A. Rydberg (1917) considered Spiraea roseata to be a hybrid of S. densiflora and S. menziesii (here S. douglasii var. menziesii), and considered S. idahoensis to be a distinct species. At this time, it is unclear whether it is indeed a hybrid or a geographic variant of S. douglasii. The occurrence of specimens in the Columbia River region suggests a hybrid origin.
